text: @eid_95f6d01c created this channel on 2026-07-12 20:30:00. This is the very beginning of the bug-georgegarcia-WorkFlowGenie channel.
@eid_95f6d01c joined bug-georgegarcia-WorkFlowGenie. Also, @eid_e214d622, @eid_c92d3e03, @eid_18571957, @eid_136119e9, @eid_1e8695b6, @eid_55f29a0d, @eid_d96bfd9b joined via invite.
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with WorkFlowGenie that need our attention. Let's go through them one by one. üòä

First up, we have a 'Notification Trigger Misconfiguration' issue. Notifications are being sent to the wrong recipients, causing confusion. This affects the Data Integration & Mapping Module and impacts customer CUST-0089. @eid_18571957, can you take this one?
Got it! I'll look into the Notification Trigger Misconfiguration issue right away. Thanks for the heads-up! üëç

Great, thanks! Next, there's a 'Deadlock in Concurrent Workflow Processing' issue. This is causing the system to become unresponsive during simultaneous workflow executions, affecting the Workflow Execution Engine. Customer CUST-0033 is impacted. @eid_18571957, this one's also for you.
Understood, I'll handle the deadlock issue as well. I'll make sure to prioritize these and keep everyone updated. üöÄ

Awesome, thanks for taking those on! Lastly, we have a 'Notification Dispatch Failure'. Notifications are delayed due to a connection issue with the Slack API, affecting the Notification System & Event Queue. This is impacting customer CUST-0075. @eid_e214d622, can you take care of this?
Sure thing! I'll dive into the Notification Dispatch Failure and see what's causing the delay. I'll keep you all posted on my progress. üîç
Thanks, @eid_e214d622! Appreciate everyone's quick response. Let's make sure to keep the customers updated as we resolve these issues. If anyone needs more info or help, just shout! üôå
Will do! If I need any additional data or support, I'll reach out. Let's get these sorted! üí™
Same here! Thanks for coordinating, @eid_95f6d01c. Let's get to work! üõ†Ô∏è
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might help us with our current Salesforce issues. Let's take a look at them! üòä

First, there's an issue in Apache Kafka titled 'Incorrect Consumer Group Offsets'. It seems messages are being consumed by the wrong consumer group due to offset misconfiguration, leading to data processing errors. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/313. This sounds a lot like our Notification Trigger Misconfiguration issue. @eid_18571957, what do you think?

Thanks, George! This Kafka issue does seem similar to what we're seeing with the notifications being sent to the wrong recipients. I'll review the PR to see if there are any insights we can apply to our situation. üëç

Great, Julia! Next up, we have a Node.js issue titled 'Event Loop Deadlock in Async Operations'. It describes how concurrent async operations can cause the event loop to freeze, making the server unresponsive under high load. Check it out here: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/314. This might give us some ideas for the deadlock issue in our Workflow Execution Engine.
This is perfect timing! The Node.js deadlock issue could definitely provide some clues for our Workflow Execution Engine problem. I'll dive into the PR and see what solutions they implemented. üöÄ

Awesome, thanks, Julia! Lastly, there's a Rocket.Chat issue titled 'Delayed Notifications via Webhook'. It involves notifications being delayed due to intermittent connection issues with external webhook services. Here's the PR: https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/pull/315. Alice, this seems similar to our Notification Dispatch Failure. Thoughts?
Thanks, George! This Rocket.Chat issue is definitely relevant to our Slack API connection problem. I'll review their approach and see if we can adapt any of their solutions. üîç
Thanks, Alice! Let's keep these open-source solutions in mind as we work through our issues. If anyone needs more info or help, just shout! üôå
Will do! I'll keep everyone updated on any findings from the Kafka and Node.js PRs. üí™
Same here! I'll share any relevant insights from the Rocket.Chat PR. Thanks for coordinating, George! üõ†Ô∏è

Hi team, the bug about incorrect notifications being sent to the wrong recipients has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/WorkFlowGenie/pull/34.

The root cause was a misconfiguration in the notification trigger logic. Specifically, the conditions for triggering notifications weren't accurately reflecting the task ownership data from Salesforce.
To fix this, I updated the logic to ensure it correctly maps task ownership data from Salesforce before triggering notifications. This should prevent any further confusion and workflow disruptions.
Great work, @eid_18571957! Thanks for jumping on this so quickly. I'll monitor the notifications to ensure everything is working smoothly.
Thanks, Julia! This was causing quite a bit of confusion. Glad to hear it's resolved. I'll also keep an eye on it from my end.
Thanks, George and Alice! Please let me know if you notice any other issues. I'll be around to help.
Hi team, the 'Notification Trigger Misconfiguration' bug has been reopened by CUST-0089. üòï
Oh no, I thought we had that one sorted out! üòÖ Do we have any details on why it was reopened, @George Garcia?
Yeah, it seems like the notifications are still being sent to the wrong recipients intermittently. The customer reported it happening again yesterday. @Julia Garcia, can you take another look at it?
Sure thing, George. I'll dive back into the logs and see what's going on. I'll keep you all posted! üîç
Thanks for jumping on it, Julia! Let us know if you need any help or if there's anything we can do to assist. üëç
Will do, Alice! I'll start by reviewing the previous fix and see if there's anything we missed. ü§î
Great, thanks @Julia Garcia! Let's aim to get this resolved quickly to minimize disruption for the customer. üöÄ
Hi team, I looked into the reported issue about the 'Notification Dispatch Failure'.
The issue was that notifications were not dispatched promptly due to a failure in the notification dispatch module, which intermittently loses connection with the Slack API.
After reviewing the situation, I found that the root cause is an unstable network connection between the WorkFlowGenie server and the Slack API.
This is actually expected behavior under the current network conditions, and not a bug in our system.
Thanks for the update, Alice. So, it's more of a network issue rather than a code problem?
Exactly, @eid_95f6d01c. The network instability is causing the intermittent failures, not a flaw in our notification dispatch module.
Did you take any steps to verify this, Alice?
Yes, Julia. I ran several tests simulating different network conditions and confirmed that the dispatch module works perfectly under stable network conditions.
Good to know. So, no changes needed on our end?
Correct, George. No changes are required in our code. However, I recommend monitoring the network stability and addressing any connectivity issues with the IT team.
Thanks for clarifying, Alice. I'll make sure to inform the IT team about the network stability concerns.
Great, thanks Julia. Let me know if there's anything else you need from me.
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with WorkFlowGenie that we need to address. Let's go through them one by one. üòä

First up, we have a 'Duplicate Task Creation' issue. This is affecting the Data Integration & Mapping Module, causing confusion with task assignments and notifications. Customer CUST-0029 is impacted. @eid_18571957, can you take this one?
Got it! I'll look into the duplicate task creation issue and see what's causing the confusion. Thanks for the heads-up! üëç

Thanks, @eid_18571957! Next, we have a 'Notification Throttling Misconfiguration' issue. Notifications are delayed due to throttling settings, impacting the Notification System & Event Queue. Customer CUST-0062 is affected. @eid_1e8695b6, can you handle this?
Sure thing! I'll dive into the throttling settings and see what's causing the delays. üöÄ

Great, thanks! Lastly, there's an 'Incorrect Field Mapping Logic' issue. This is also in the Data Integration & Mapping Module, leading to incorrect task assignments. Customer CUST-0079 is experiencing this. @eid_1e8695b6, can you take this one as well?
Absolutely, I'll tackle the field mapping logic issue too. Let's get these sorted out for our customers! üí™
Awesome, thanks everyone for jumping on these so quickly! If you need any more details or run into any roadblocks, just shout. Let's keep our customers happy! üéâ
Will do! I'll update once I have more info on the duplicate tasks. üõ†Ô∏è
Same here, I'll keep you posted on both issues. Thanks for coordinating, @eid_95f6d01c!
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might help us with our current Salesforce issues. Let's take a look at them! üòä

First up, there's a 'Duplicate Job Execution' issue in Jenkins. Users are reporting that scheduled jobs are being executed multiple times, which sounds a lot like our 'Duplicate Task Creation' problem. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/pull/321. @eid_18571957, what do you think?

Thanks, George! This Jenkins issue does seem similar to what we're seeing with the duplicate tasks. I'll review the PR to see how they approached the fix and see if we can apply any of their solutions. üëç

Great, Julia! Next, we have a 'Delayed Message Notifications' issue in Rocket.Chat. This is due to misconfigured throttling, which is causing delays in notification delivery. Sounds familiar, right? Here's the PR: https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/pull/322. Charlie, any thoughts?
Definitely sounds like our 'Notification Throttling Misconfiguration' issue! I'll check out their approach to handling throttling settings and see if we can learn from it. üöÄ

Awesome, Charlie! Lastly, there's an 'Incorrect Data Flow Mapping' issue in Apache NiFi. Their data flow configurations are incorrectly mapped, leading to errors, which is similar to our 'Incorrect Field Mapping Logic' issue. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/323.
I'll take a look at this one too. It might give us some insights into fixing our field mapping logic. Let's get these sorted out! üí™
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep each other updated on any findings or solutions we can apply. If you need any more details or run into any roadblocks, just shout. Let's keep our customers happy! üéâ
Will do! I'll update once I have more info on the Jenkins issue. üõ†Ô∏è
Same here, I'll keep you posted on both the Rocket.Chat and Apache NiFi issues. Thanks for coordinating, George!
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with WorkFlowGenie that we need to address. Let's go through them one by one. üòä

First up, we have an issue titled 'Event Queue Overflow'. The event queue handling Salesforce data updates is getting overloaded, causing delays in notifications. This affects the Notification System & Event Queue, impacting customer CUST-0115. @eid_55f29a0d, can you take this one?
Got it! I'll start looking into the 'Event Queue Overflow' issue right away. Thanks for the heads-up! üöÄ

Great, thanks! Next, we have 'Notification Flooding During Workflow Execution'. This is causing system slowdowns or crashes, especially with complex workflows. It's affecting the Workflow Execution Engine and customer CUST-0033. @eid_c92d3e03, can you handle this?
Sure thing! I'll dive into the 'Notification Flooding' issue and see what's causing the excessive notifications. Let's get this sorted! üí™

Awesome, thanks! Lastly, we have 'Inconsistent Font Scaling' in the setup wizard. This is causing visual clutter and setup challenges for customer CUST-0089. It affects the User Interface & Setup Wizard. @eid_18571957, can you take a look?
On it! I'll check out the font scaling issue and make sure the setup wizard looks consistent. Thanks for assigning this to me! üëç
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep the communication open. If you need any more details or run into roadblocks, just shout. Let's get these issues resolved for our customers! üôå
Will do! I'll update once I have more info on the event queue. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Same here, I'll keep you posted on the notification flooding. Thanks, team! ü§ù
I'll share updates on the UI issue as I progress. Let's make it happen! üöÄ
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might give us insights into our current issues. Let's take a look! üòä

First up, we have a 'Message Queue Overflow' issue in Apache Kafka. It's similar to our 'Event Queue Overflow' problem, where a high volume of incoming messages slows down the broker, delaying message delivery. Check it out here: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/325. @eid_55f29a0d, what do you think?
Thanks, George! This looks quite similar to what we're facing with the event queue. I'll dive into the PR and see if there are any strategies we can apply to our situation. üöÄ

Great, Charlie! Next, there's an 'Excessive Notification Triggers' issue in Jenkins. It involves build notifications being sent multiple times during complex pipeline executions, leading to email flooding. Sounds familiar, right? Here's the link: https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/pull/326. Julia Brown, any thoughts?

Absolutely, George! This is very similar to our 'Notification Flooding During Workflow Execution'. I'll review the Jenkins PR to see how they tackled it and if we can adopt any of their solutions. üí™

Awesome, thanks, Julia! Lastly, there's an 'Inconsistent UI Scaling' issue in GIMP. It deals with UI elements scaling improperly on high-DPI displays, causing layout issues. Here's the PR: https://github.com/GNOME/gimp/pull/327. Julia Garcia, does this resonate with our 'Inconsistent Font Scaling' issue?
Yes, George, it does! I'll take a look at how GIMP is handling this and see if we can apply similar fixes to our setup wizard. Thanks for pointing this out! üëç
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep these insights in mind as we work on our issues. Feel free to reach out if you need more info or run into any roadblocks. Let's get these resolved for our customers! üôå
Will do, George! I'll update once I have more info on the event queue. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Same here, I'll keep you posted on the notification flooding. Thanks, team! ü§ù
I'll share updates on the UI issue as I progress. Let's make it happen! üöÄ
Hi team, the bug about incorrect field mapping logic has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/WorkFlowGenie/pull/36.

The root cause was a logical error in the field mapping algorithm. Specifically, certain Salesforce fields were incorrectly mapped to Slack task parameters, which led to tasks being assigned based on incorrect field values.

To fix this, I updated the mapping logic to correctly align Salesforce fields with the appropriate Slack task parameters. I also added unit tests to ensure this mapping logic remains accurate in future updates.
Great work, @eid_1e8695b6! Thanks for resolving this so quickly.
Thanks, Charlie! This should help prevent any more task assignment issues. I'll review the changes and run some tests on my end as well.
Thanks, @eid_18571957. Let me know if you encounter any issues during testing.
I'll also keep an eye on the task assignments to ensure everything is working smoothly. Thanks again, Charlie!
Hey team, just got word that the 'Incorrect Field Mapping Logic' bug has been reopened. üòï Seems like the issue is still affecting CUST-0079.
Oh no, really? I thought we had that sorted out. Let me take a look at the details again. @George Garcia, do we have any new info on what might be causing it?
Yeah, it seems like the mapping logic is still assigning tasks incorrectly. The customer reported the same issue after the last update. @Charlie Martinez, could you dive into this once more?
Absolutely, I'll jump on it right away. I'll review the previous fix and see if there's anything we missed. Thanks for the heads-up, George! üîç
Let me know if you need any help with testing or reviewing the logic, @Charlie Martinez. We need to make sure this is fully resolved this time. üôå
Thanks, Julia! I'll keep you posted. Let's get this fixed for good. üí™
Hi team, the bug about incorrect notification throttling has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/WorkFlowGenie/pull/37.
Great news, Charlie! What was causing the issue?
The root cause was an incorrect configuration of the notification throttling parameters. They were set too aggressively, which led to excessive rate limiting even during normal operations.
Thanks for the update, @eid_1e8695b6. How did you manage to fix it?

I adjusted the throttling parameters to align with our expected notification volume. This involved recalibrating the rate limits to ensure they only kick in during peak loads, not under normal conditions.
Sounds like a solid fix, Charlie. Thanks for handling this so quickly!
Agreed, thanks for the quick turnaround, Charlie. I'll keep an eye on the notifications to ensure everything's running smoothly.
Thanks, George and Julia. Let me know if you notice any further issues. I'm here to help!
Hi team, the 'Notification Throttling Misconfiguration' bug has been reopened. üòï Customer CUST-0062 is still experiencing delays. @eid_1e8695b6, could you take a look?
Oh no, I thought we had this one sorted out. üòÖ Let me check the logs and see what's going on. @George Garcia, do we have any new details from the customer?
Not much more than before, @Charlie Martinez. They just reported that the delays are still happening intermittently. Maybe there's something we missed in the config?
Hey team, just saw this. @Charlie Martinez, do you need any help digging into the throttling settings again? Maybe a fresh pair of eyes could help. üëÄ
Thanks, @Julia Garcia! That would be great. I'll start by reviewing the previous fix and see if there's anything we overlooked. Let's sync up later today to go over what we find. üîç
Sounds like a plan. Keep us posted on any updates. Thanks for jumping on this quickly, team! üôå
Hi team, the bug titled 'Event Queue Overflow' has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/WorkFlowGenie/pull/38.
Great news, Charlie! Can you remind us what the root cause was?
Sure, George. The root cause was that our system lacked adequate throttling mechanisms to handle high volumes of incoming events, which led to an overflow in the event queue.
Thanks for the update, Charlie. How did you manage to fix it?
We implemented a dynamic throttling mechanism that adjusts based on the current load. This ensures that the event queue processes events at a manageable rate, preventing overflow and backlog.
That sounds like a solid solution, Charlie. Thanks for addressing this so quickly!
No problem, Julia Garcia. Let me know if you notice any more issues or if there's anything else I can help with.
Will do. Thanks again, Charlie!

Hi team, the bug titled 'Notification Flooding During Workflow Execution' has been resolved. üéâ You can check out the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/WorkFlowGenie/pull/39.
Great news, @eid_c92d3e03! Can you remind us what was causing the issue?

Sure, George. The root cause was a bug in the notification triggering logic within the Workflow Execution Engine. It wasn't throttling or batching notifications effectively, which led to excessive notifications being triggered.
Thanks for the update, Julia. How did you manage to fix it?

I implemented a throttling mechanism that limits the number of notifications sent per minute and added a batching process to group notifications together. This should prevent the system from being overwhelmed during workflow execution.
Awesome work, Julia Brown! This should really help with the system stability. Thanks for tackling this so quickly.
No problem, @eid_18571957! Let me know if you notice any other issues. I'm here to help. üòä
Thanks again, Julia. I'll keep an eye on the system performance and let you know if anything comes up.
Same here. Thanks for the quick turnaround, Julia!
Hi team, I looked into the reported issue about the inconsistent font scaling in the setup wizard.
The bug was described as text scaling inconsistently across different sections, causing some instructions to be too small or too large.
After reviewing the implementation, I found that this behavior is actually due to the responsive typography settings we have in place.
@eid_95f6d01c George, the scaling adjusts based on the viewport size and device pixel ratio, which is expected behavior for our design.
I checked the settings and confirmed that the typography is functioning as intended. It seems like this might be a case of user misunderstanding rather than a bug.
To ensure everything is working correctly, I tested the setup wizard on multiple devices and screen sizes. The scaling is consistent with our design guidelines.
Thanks for the update, Julia. It's good to know that the system is working as expected. Maybe we should add a note in the documentation to clarify this behavior?
Agreed, @eid_18571957. A note in the documentation could help prevent future confusion.
Thanks, Julia. I'll make sure to update the documentation to reflect this information.
Great, thanks everyone! Let me know if there's anything else you need from me on this.
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with WorkFlowGenie that we need to address ASAP. Let's go through them one by one. üöÄ

First up, we have a 'Delayed Notification Trigger' issue. Notifications meant to alert users of important Salesforce data changes are delayed, sometimes by several hours. This affects the Notification System & Event Queue and impacts customer CUST-0103. @eid_c92d3e03, can you take this one?
Got it! I'll dive into the Notification System & Event Queue to see what's causing the delay. Thanks for the heads-up, @eid_95f6d01c. üëç

Great, thanks! Next, we have an 'Overlapping Notification Settings' issue. The settings panel overlaps with the main workflow configuration area, making it hard for users to adjust preferences. This affects the User Interface & Setup Wizard and impacts customer CUST-0035. @eid_136119e9, can you handle this?
Sure thing! I'll check out the UI and Setup Wizard to fix the overlap. Thanks for assigning this to me, @eid_95f6d01c. üòä

Awesome, thanks! Lastly, there's an 'Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR) in Configuration URLs' issue. Unauthorized users can view and modify workflow settings by manipulating URL parameters. This affects the Access Control & Security Module and impacts customer CUST-0041. @eid_c92d3e03, can you also take this one?
Absolutely, I'll prioritize this security issue and ensure our Access Control & Security Module is tightened up. Thanks for looping me in, @eid_95f6d01c. üîí
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep communication open and update each other on progress. Feel free to reach out if you need any help or additional context. üôå
Will do! Let's get these issues sorted for our customers. üí™
On it! Let's make sure WorkFlowGenie is running smoothly for everyone. üöÄ
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might help us with our current Salesforce issues. Let's take a look at them! üöÄ

First up, we have a 'Delayed Message Notifications' issue in Rocket.Chat. Users are experiencing delays in receiving chat notifications, similar to our 'Delayed Notification Trigger' problem. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/pull/337. @eid_c92d3e03, any thoughts on this?
Thanks, George! This is quite similar to what we're seeing with our Notification System. I'll review their approach and see if we can apply any of their solutions to our Event Queue. üëç

Great, Julia! Next, there's an 'Admin Panel Overlapping Menus' issue in WordPress. This is akin to our 'Overlapping Notification Settings' problem. Check out the PR here: https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/pull/338. Bob, could you take a look at this one?
Sure thing, George! I'll dive into their fix and see if it can help us with our UI overlap issue. Thanks for pointing this out! üòä

Awesome, Bob! Lastly, there's an 'Insecure URL Parameter Handling' issue in Jenkins. Unauthorized users can modify job configurations by altering URL parameters, similar to our IDOR issue. Here's the PR: https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/pull/339. Julia, could you also check this one out?
Absolutely, George! I'll review their security measures and see how we can enhance our Access Control & Security Module. üîí
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep these insights in mind as we work on our fixes. Feel free to share any findings or need for collaboration. üôå
Will do, George! Let's leverage these open-source solutions to improve our products. üí™
On it! Let's make sure our customers get the best experience possible. üöÄ
Hi team, the bug about incorrect overlapping of the notification settings panel has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/WorkFlowGenie/pull/44.
The issue was caused by a JavaScript event handling error, which led to the notification settings panel being incorrectly positioned when triggered, especially after resizing the browser window.

To fix this, I adjusted the event listener to properly calculate the panel's position relative to the main workflow configuration area. This ensures that the panel remains correctly aligned, even after the window is resized.
Thanks for the update, Bob! Great to hear it's fixed. I'll test it out and let you know if I spot anything else.
@eid_136119e9 Awesome work, Bob! This was a tricky one. I'll also give it a run-through to ensure everything's working smoothly.
Thanks, George and Julia! Let me know if you encounter any issues. I'm here to help if needed.
Hi team, I looked into the reported issue about the delayed notification trigger. After a thorough review, I've determined that it doesn't require a fix.
Hey @eid_c92d3e03, can you explain why it's not a bug? The delays seem to impact our real-time communication.

Sure, George. The delays are actually due to a known bottleneck in the event processing queue when there's a high volume of Salesforce data updates. This is expected behavior under heavy load conditions.
Thanks for the update, Julia. So, is there anything we can do to mitigate this, or is it something we just have to live with?

Good question, Bob. We can optimize the queue processing by adjusting the configuration settings to better handle peak loads. However, this isn't a bug per se, but rather a capacity issue that can be managed with proper configuration.
Got it, Julia. So, it's more about managing expectations and configurations rather than fixing a bug. Thanks for clarifying!
Exactly, George. I'll document the findings and recommendations for configuration adjustments. Let me know if there's anything else you need.
Thanks, Julia. That makes sense. Appreciate the quick turnaround on this!
Hi team, the 'Delayed Notification Trigger' bug has been reopened by customer CUST-0103. They are still experiencing significant delays in notifications. üòï
Oh, that's unexpected. I thought we had addressed this as a capacity issue. @George, did they provide any new details?
Hey @Julia, they mentioned that the delays are occurring even during off-peak times now, which wasn't the case before. Seems like something else might be at play here.
Hmm, that's interesting. Maybe there's a new factor affecting the queue processing. ü§î
Alright, I'll take another look at it. Could be worth checking if there have been any recent changes in the Salesforce data update patterns or any new integrations. I'll start with that. üëç
Thanks, Julia! Let us know if you need any help or additional info from the customer. @Bob, maybe you can assist Julia if she needs any support with the queue configurations?
Sure thing, George. @Julia, just ping me if you need a hand. Let's get this sorted out for CUST-0103. üí™
Will do, Bob. Thanks, everyone! I'll keep you posted on what I find. üòä
